animatedSpriteEditor.files

Class EditorFileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • animatedSpriteEditor.files.EditorFileManager

  • public class EditorFileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides all the file servicing for the AnimatedSpriteEditor application.This means it directs all operations regarding loading, exporting, creating, and saving files, Note that it employs use of AnimatedSpriteEditorIO for the actual file work, this class manages when to actually read and write from/to files, prompting the user when necessary for file names and validation on actions.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sixin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EditorFileManager()
      This default constructor starts the program without a pose file being edited.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isSaved()
      Accessor method for checking to see if the current pose has been saved since it was last editing.
      void markFileAsNotSaved()
      This mutator method marks the file as not saved, which means that when the user wants to do a file-type operation, we should prompt the user to save current work first.
      void requestExit()
      This method will exit the application, making sure the user doesn't lose any data first.
      void requestExportPose()
      This method will export the current pose to an image file.
      void requestNew()
      This method starts the process of editing a new sprite type.
      void requestNewPose()
      This method starts the process of editing a new pose.
      void requestNewState()
      This method starts the process of editing a new state.
      void requestOpen()
      This method lets the user open a spriteType saved to a file.
      void requestOpenPose()
      This method lets the user open a pose saved to a file.
      void requestOpenState()
      This method lets the user open a state saved to a file.
      void requestSaveAsPose()
      This method will save the current pose as a named file provided by the user.
      void requestSavePose()
      This method will save the current pose to a file.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EditorFileManager

        public EditorFileManager()
        This default constructor starts the program without a pose file being edited.

    • Method Detail

      • requestNewPose

        public void requestNewPose()
        This method starts the process of editing a new pose. If a pose is already being edited, it will prompt the user to save it first.

      • requestNewState

        public void requestNewState()
        This method starts the process of editing a new state. If a pose is already being edited, it will prompt the user to save it first.

      • requestNew

        public void requestNew()
        This method starts the process of editing a new sprite type. If a pose is already being edited, it will prompt the user to save it first.

      • requestOpen

        public void requestOpen()
        This method lets the user open a spriteType saved to a file. It will also make sure data for the current pose is not lost.

      • requestOpenPose

        public void requestOpenPose()
        This method lets the user open a pose saved to a file. It will also make sure data for the current pose is not lost.

      • requestOpenState

        public void requestOpenState()
        This method lets the user open a state saved to a file. It will also make sure data for the current pose is not lost.

      • requestSavePose

        public void requestSavePose()
        This method will save the current pose to a file. Note that we already know the name of the file, so we won't need to prompt the user.

      • requestSaveAsPose

        public void requestSaveAsPose()
        This method will save the current pose as a named file provided by the user.

      • requestExportPose

        public void requestExportPose()
        This method will export the current pose to an image file.

      • requestExit

        public void requestExit()
        This method will exit the application, making sure the user doesn't lose any data first.

      • markFileAsNotSaved

        public void markFileAsNotSaved()
        This mutator method marks the file as not saved, which means that when the user wants to do a file-type operation, we should prompt the user to save current work first. Note that this method should be called any time the pose is changed in some way.

      • isSaved

        public boolean isSaved()
        Accessor method for checking to see if the current pose has been saved since it was last editing. If the current file matches the pose data, we'll return true, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if the current pose is saved to the file, false otherwise.
